definitions.text: become different in some particular way, without permanently losing one's or its former characteristics or essence
examples: her mood changes in accordance with the weather
The supermarket's selection of vegetables varies according to the season

definitions.text: be at variance with; be out of line with
be subject to change in accordance with a variable
examples: His moods vary depending on the weather

definitions.text: make something more diverse and varied

examples: immigrants' varied ethnic and religious traditions
his work is interesting and varied
varied motives prompt people to join a political party
varied ethnic traditions of the immigrants

definitions.text: broken away from sameness or identity or duplication
examples: her quickly varied answers indicated uncertainty
